TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1237
TEI.2.document_title: George Orr to Stephen F. Austin, 12-01-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Asks for translation of colonization law.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1237

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Asks for translation of colonization law.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Trinity Taskasito*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="12-01-1825">1st December 1825*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Dear Sir.*/p*
*p*The peculiarity of Interest I feel on the subject induce me to solicit a favor from you, which from the liberality of your disposition I anticipate will be granted: I should be very glad to receive from your kindly office by the first safe conveyance a Translated copy of the Colonization Laws relating to conditions of Locations of Lands etc etc in this *location_mentioned*province*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*Your complyance will place me under an obligation which will be most cheerfully reciprocated on the first occasion*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*George Orr*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*NB Any charge for the Copy of the Laws I will pay on demand.*/p*
*p*[Addressed]: To his Excellency *person_mentioned*Colonel Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* at *location_mentioned*St. Felipe de Austin Province of Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
